sponsor: Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health
briefTitle: Study of Acid Reflux in Asthma
officialTitle: The Study of Acid Reflux in Asthma
summary: The purpose of this study is to determine if subjects with symptomatic asthma who are assigned to treatment with a proton pump inhibitor (PPI) drug such as Nexium have fewer asthma attacks than similar subjects assigned to placebo treatment.

primaryOutcome.measure: Episodes of Poor Asthma Control (EPAC) From Diary Cards, According to Definition That Did Not Include Use of Beta-agonists as a Criterion
